blight.noObj: No blight available; report to mod developer.

card.noFurtherUpgrade: This card cannot be upgraded any further.
card.noObj: No card available; report to mod developer.

content.unknownKeyword: Unknown keyword {unknownKeyword} found; report to mod developer.

monster.noObj: No monster available; report to mod developer.

orb.noObj: No orb available; report to mod developer.

player.noObj: No player available; report to mod developer.

potion.noObj: No potion available; report to mod developer.

relic.noObj: No relic available; report to mod developer.

base.label: Settings
base.description: Settings for the base Say the Spire mod.

advanced.label: Advanced
advanced.description: Advanced settings related to the internals of the mod.

use_updated_card_description.label: Use Updated Card Description
use_updated_card_description.description: whether or not to use a different internal property to get card descriptions. This should be enabled if you are trying to use mods that do not have properly rendered card descriptions. This may break depending on your current game language so use this with caution.

prefered_speech_handler_order.label: Prefered Speech Handler Order
prefered_speech_handler_order.description: Your prefered order of speech handlers. For more information, see the documentation on speech handlers.

speech_handler_force_system_speech.label: Force System Speech for Speech Handlers
speech_handler_force_system_speech.description: Whether or not system speech (for example SAPI) is used (if your speech handler supports it.)

combat.label: Combat
combat.description: Settings related to reading of combat events.

block_text.label: Read Block Text
block_text.description: Whether or not to read when a creature gains block.

buff_debuff_text.label: Read Buff and Debuff Text
buff_debuff_text.description: Whether or not to read when a creature gains a buff or debuff.

card_events.label: Read Card Events
card_events.description: Whether or not card events are read. These include cards being added to draw, discard, etc as well as cards being exhausted.

orb_events.label: Read Orb Events
orb_events.description: Whether or not orb events are read. This includes when orbs are channeled and evoked.

virtual_input.label: Virtual Input
virtual_input.description: Whether or not virtual input is enabled.

read_reversed_paths.label: Read Reversed Paths
read_reversed_paths.description: Whether or not to read the path in reverse when moving backward on the map, as if you were tracing it visually. Many people prefer to disable this to save time but it is enabled by default for clarity.

ui.label: UI
ui.description: Contains settings related to the game's UI and how certain elements are read out.

read_proceed_text.label: Read Proceed Text
read_proceed_text.description: Whether or not to read the proceed text when the option is available (for example to skip a combat reward.)

read_banner_text.label: Read Banner Text
read_banner_text.description: Whether or not banner text is read. Banner text appears at the top of the screen and generally acts as a screen title.

read_positions.label: Read Positions
read_positions.description: Whether or not to read the position of an element (for example 1 of 3 in a list.)

read_types.label: Read Element Types
read_types.description: Whether or not element types, such as button, are read for each UI element.

read_obtain_events.label: Read Obtain Events
read_obtain_events.description: Whether or not the mod notifies you when you obtain an object (such as a card, potion, relic, etc.)

exclude_read_typenames.label: Exclude Specific Element Typenames
exclude_read_typenames.description: A list of types to not be read. For example if you do not want cards and relics to say card or relic after their name, you could add card or button to the list and they would not be read out, leaving all other element types to be read.

resources.label: Resources
resources.description: Settings related to how resources are loaded and unloaded.

unload_native_libs.label: Unload Native Libraries
unload_native_libs.description: Whether or not to unload the screen reader libraries from memory when the game closes.

dispose_resource_files.label: Dispose Resource Files
dispose_resource_files.description: Whether or not to delete the screen reader dll files in the slay the Spire root directory after the game closes and they are unloaded from memory. Do not enable this unless unload_native_libs is enabled or it won't work.

errors.unknownGremlinMatchCard: Error: Unknown gremlin match game card, report to mod dev.

tree.error focus null: Focus node is null; report to mod developer

accessibility notes.keyboard: Accessibility note: Enter text with keyboard

buffers.currentItemIsNull: Buffer {buffer} current item is null, report to mod developer

character button.unknown unlock: Unknown unlock text; report to mod developer.

slider.unknownType: Unknown slider type; report to mod developer.

toggle button.unknownType: Unknown toggle button type; report to mod developer.

DungeonMapScreen.boss scroll: The map scrolls from top to bottom, briefly revealing the sketched outline of {boss}.

clipboard.label: Clipboard (all platforms)
clipboard.description: Sends all text output to the clipboard. This is useful for translation or for some specific screen readers.

speech-dispatcher.label: Speech Dispatcher (Linux)
speech-dispatcher.description: Uses Speech-Dispatcher (screen reader output) library for Linux. This requires some initial setup; please see the documentation for more information.

tolk.label: Tolk (Windows)
tolk.description: Uses the Tolk (screen reader output) library for Windows. You will need to copy required screenreader dll files to the game directory to use this handler.

tolk_resources.label: Tolk with Bundled Resource Files (Windows)
tolk_resources.description: Uses the Tolk (screen reader output) library for Windows and automatically extracts dlls needed at runtime. Dll files are removed when the game is closed.
